description: This super simple and nutritious quinoa fried rice is loaded with vegetables and bursting with flavor. An easy weeknight dinner that everyone will love.
keywords: quinoa, fried rice, vegan, gluten free, plantbased
name: Veggie Loaded Quinoa Fried Rice
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp oil (you can use any kind here, we used sesame oil)
8oz baby Bella (cremini mushrooms) or white mushrooms, sliced
Tofu (we love using this one for this dish )

recipeInstructions.text: To prepare the quinoa, heat the oil in a medium-size saucepan. Add the quinoa and cook over medium heat for 1-2 minutes, stirring often, so it's well coated with the oil. Add 1 1/3 cups of water and the salt. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the water has been absorbed and the quinoa is tender but not mushy. Remove from the heat, let sit, covered for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork. Set aside

In the meantime, heat 2 teaspoons of the sesame oil in a large nonstick skillet or wok. Add the broccoli and cook over medium-high heat for 3-5 minutes (depending on how firm you like it), tossing often. Set aside
Heat the remaining 2 teaspoons of sesame oil. Add the zucchini, yellow squash and mushrooms and cook over medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes (again, depending on how firm you like it).
Reduce the heat to medium, add the cooked broccoli, edamame, corn, grated ginger, garlic, cooked quinoa, tamari, and coconut aminos and toss well. Cook for another 3 minutes.
